# The `cl` Namespace Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

This namespace contains all of the command line option processing machinery. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Description {#details}

This namespace contains all of the command line option processing machinery.

It is intentionally a short name to make qualified usage concise.

<SectionDefinition>

## Typedefs

                                   bool MarkEOLs)</>}>

### AddExtraVersionPrinter() {#af482fe65d5cc4df7480d60fdf731c14e}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::AddExtraVersionPrinter (<a href="#ac3e62bf5bd0eaf734178c981bdbd53c9">VersionPrinterTy</a> func)</>}>
===------------------------------------------------------------------—===// Add an extra printer to use in addition to the default one.

This can be called multiple times, and each time it adds a new function to the list which will be called after the basic LLVM version printing is complete. Each can then add additional information specific to the tool.

### getRegisteredOptions() {#a6d52a42303dabd7949d77a3da9d1ee6a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>StringMap&lt; Option &#42; &gt; &amp; llvm::cl::getRegisteredOptions (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/subcommand">SubCommand</a> &amp; Sub=<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/cl/subcommand/#a3faf2de70f129bd4fc2eeff949d81806">SubCommand::getTopLevel</a>())</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/use">Use</a> this to get a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> to all registered named options (e.g.

-help).


<SectionUser title="Returns">
A reference to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap</a> used by the cl APIs to parse options.
</SectionUser>

Access to unnamed arguments (i.e. positional) are not provided because it is expected that the client already has access to these.

Typical usage: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">main(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> argc,</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#42; argv&#91;&#93;) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap">StringMap&lt;llvm::cl::Option&#42;&gt;</a> &amp;opts = <a href="#a6d52a42303dabd7949d77a3da9d1ee6a">llvm::cl::getRegisteredOptions</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/silowercontrolflow-cpp/#a4868c5d81c5ccc98c47aeab6244346a0">assert</a>(opts.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringmap/#a9846bb2bc5672e7627011260772b8d09">count</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;help&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) == 1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">opts&#91;</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;help&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#93;-&gt;setDescription(</Highlight><Highlight kind="stringliteral">&quot;Show alphabetical help information&quot;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// More code</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm">llvm</a>::<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/cl">cl</a>::<a href="#a7225497318f6c1bd57e8a80d4273031e">ParseCommandLineOptions</a>(argc,argv);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">//More code</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

This interface is useful for modifying options in libraries that are out of the control of the client. The options should be modified before calling <a href="#a7225497318f6c1bd57e8a80d4273031e">llvm::cl::ParseCommandLineOptions()</a>.

Hopefully this API can be deprecated soon. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> situation where options need to be modified by tools or libraries should be handled by sane APIs rather than just handing around a global list.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h/#l02040">2040</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">CommandLine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp/#l02788">2788</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp">CommandLine.cpp</a>.

### tokenizeConfigFile() {#a67d781b9bcae2cbdf19f35456132a85b}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::tokenizeConfigFile (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Source, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a> &amp; Saver, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; &gt; &amp; NewArgv, bool MarkEOLs=false)</>}>
Tokenizes content of configuration file.

<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Source">The string representing content of config file.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Saver">Delegates back to the caller for saving parsed strings.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] NewArgv">All parsed strings are appended to NewArgv.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MarkEOLs">Added for compatibility with <a href="#aa144b3e610059b7ef30a701d90da8286">TokenizerCallback</a>.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>
It works like TokenizeGNUCommandLine with ability to skip comment lines.

### TokenizeGNUCommandLine() {#aff28c3d477d3a7870ec643381f186ed4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::TokenizeGNUCommandLine (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Source, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a> &amp; Saver, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; &gt; &amp; NewArgv, bool MarkEOLs=false)</>}>
Tokenizes a command line that can contain escapes and quotes.

The quoting rules match those used by GCC and other tools that use libiberty&#39;s buildargv() or expandargv() utilities, and do not match bash. They differ from buildargv() on treatment of backslashes that do not escape a special character to make it possible to accept most Windows file paths.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Source">The string to be split on whitespace with quotes.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Saver">Delegates back to the caller for saving parsed strings.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MarkEOLs">true if tokenizing a response file and you want end of lines and end of the response file to be marked with a nullptr string.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] NewArgv">All parsed strings are appended to NewArgv.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h/#l02080">2080</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">CommandLine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp/#l00821">821</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp">CommandLine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### TokenizeWindowsCommandLine() {#a3b42fd69f84c0ceef44857e925613ee4}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::TokenizeWindowsCommandLine (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Source, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a> &amp; Saver, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; &gt; &amp; NewArgv, bool MarkEOLs=false)</>}>
Tokenizes a string of Windows command line arguments, which may contain quotes and escaped quotes.

See MSDN docs for CommandLineToArgvW for information on the quoting rules. <a href="http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/17w5ykft(v=vs.85).aspx">http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/17w5ykft(v=vs.85).aspx</a>

For handling a full Windows command line including the executable name at the start, see TokenizeWindowsCommandLineFull below.


<ParametersList title="Parameters">
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Source">The string to be split on whitespace with quotes.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] Saver">Delegates back to the caller for saving parsed strings.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[in] MarkEOLs">true if tokenizing a response file and you want end of lines and end of the response file to be marked with a nullptr string.</ParametersListItem>
<ParametersListItem name="[out] NewArgv">All parsed strings are appended to NewArgv.</ParametersListItem>
</ParametersList>

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h/#l02098">2098</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">CommandLine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp/#l01041">1041</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp">CommandLine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### TokenizeWindowsCommandLineFull() {#af896b229210e1e59c2d9f66112fc48d3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::TokenizeWindowsCommandLineFull (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Source, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a> &amp; Saver, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> char &#42; &gt; &amp; NewArgv, bool MarkEOLs=false)</>}>
Tokenizes a Windows full command line, including command name at the start.

This uses the same syntax rules as TokenizeWindowsCommandLine for all but the first token. But the first token is expected to be parsed as the executable file name in the way CreateProcess would do it, rather than the way the C library startup code would do it: CreateProcess does not consider that \\ is ever an escape character (because &quot; is not a valid filename char, hence there&#39;s never a need to escape it to be used literally).

Parameters are the same as for TokenizeWindowsCommandLine. In particular, if you set MarkEOLs = true, then the first word of every line will be parsed using the special rules for command names, making this function suitable for parsing a file full of commands to execute.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h/#l02122">2122</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">CommandLine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp/#l01061">1061</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp">CommandLine.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### TokenizeWindowsCommandLineNoCopy() {#a8d80076c6887cc447e544881292a3ad0}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>void llvm::cl::TokenizeWindowsCommandLineNoCopy (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Source, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a> &amp; Saver, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> &gt; &amp; NewArgv)</>}>
Tokenizes a Windows command line while attempting to avoid copies.

If no quoting or escaping was used, this produces substrings of the original string. If a token requires unquoting, it will be allocated with the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringsaver">StringSaver</a>.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h/#l02106">2106</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/commandline-h">CommandLine.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp/#l01053">1053</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/commandline-cpp">CommandLine.cpp</a>.
